track.name: Algorithms
track.descriptions: The true test of problem solving: when one realizes that time and memory aren't infinite.

primary_contest.description:
101 Hack is back! HackerRank will be hosting 101 Hack on the last saturday of every month at 17:00 UTC, starting this month. Now, you know for sure what to look forward to last saturday of every month!

It's all about speed, accuracy and efficiency. Inside the contest are 3 challenges. You have exactly 180 minutes to solve them. Every second counts.

HackerRank invites you to join the contest to compete against hackers from across the globe.

Next up is 20/20 Hack on July 6th


Sign up at www.hackerrank.com/2020hack
primary_contest.name: 101 Hack June

model.name: Anagram
model.php_template:
<?php

$handle = fopen ("php://stdin", "r");
function anagram($s){
    // Complete this function
}

fscanf($handle, "%i",$q);
for($a0 = 0; $a0 < $q; $a0++){
    fscanf($handle, "%s",$s);
    $result = anagaram($s);
    echo $result . "\n";
}

?>
model.haskell_template:
import Control.Applicative
import Control.Monad
import System.IO


main :: IO ()
main = do
    q_temp <- getLine
    let q = read q_temp :: Int
    forM_ [1..q] $ \a0  -> do
        s <- getLine


getMultipleLines :: Int -> IO [String]

getMultipleLines n
    | n <= 0 = return []
    | otherwise = do          
        x <- getLine         
        xs <- getMultipleLines (n-1)    
        let ret = (x:xs)    
        return ret
model.preview: Find the minimum number of characters of the first string that we need to change in order to make it an anagram of the second string.
model.clojure_template:
(use '[clojure.string :only (split triml)])

(
        let [
          q_t (read-line) 
          q (Integer/parseInt q_t) 
        ]

      (
        loop [a0 q]
        (when (> a0 0)

          (
            let [
              s (read-line)  
            ]
          )

        (recur (- a0 1) ) )
      )

)
model.erlang_template:
-module(solution).
-export([main/0]).

main() ->

    { ok, [Q]} = io:fread("", "~d"),
    Q_list = lists:seq(1,Q),
    lists:foreach( fun(Q0) ->
            { ok, [S]} = io:fread("", "~s")
    end,Q_list),
    true.

read_array(0,D) -> [];
read_array(N,D) -> 
	{ok, [X]} = io:fread("", D),
	[X | read_array(N-1,D)].

read_2darray(0,M,D) -> [];
read_2darray(N,M,D) ->
	Q=read_array(M,D),
	[Q | read_2darray(N-1,M,D)].
model.lua_template:
function anagram(s)
    -- Complete this function

q = io.read("*number", "*l")
a0 = 0
while a0 < q do
    s = io.read()
    a0 = a0 + 1
end
